intro: Vitex dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's vitex, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Vitex dinklagei is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing unique adaptations to its harsh habitat.
